parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be directly linked to an officially registered campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Mohammad Murad, a candidate for AUR (Alianța pentru Unirea Românilor) for the position of deputy, specifying his place on the list. This directly identifies a parliamentary candidate, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, the content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The platform itself is public, further supporting this conclusion. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post discusses Murad's candidacy, his party's proposals for the parliamentary elections, and the candidate AUR will support in the second round of the presidential elections. The clear objective is to promote Murad and, by extension, the AUR party, influencing voters' choices. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post is presented in a format resembling a news segment, its primary purpose is not objective journalism. The focus is on promoting a specific candidate and party, exceeding the boundaries of impartial news reporting.  It does not meet the criteria of journalistic reporting as defined in Article 36 (7) - d.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a promotional piece for a political candidate and party. The interview format doesn't disguise its promotional intent.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1618099118787045</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes Mohammad Murad, an AUR candidate for the parliamentary elections.  It highlights his candidacy, his party's platform, and their stance on the presidential elections.  The paid nature of the post, its public reach on Facebook, and its clear intention to influence voters strongly suggest it constitutes electoral propaganda.  The post fulfills all criteria of Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, defining electoral propaganda.  The fact that the post was published after the official end of the electoral campaign period (assuming the parliamentary elections are over) makes it a violation of Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Mohammad Murad</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Tomis Tv</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Tomis Tv, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1618099118787045) cu caracter de propagandă electorală, promovând candidatura lui Mohammad Murad pentru AUR la alegerile parlamentare. Postarea, plătită cu o sumă sub 100 RON, conform Ad Library, a atins o audiență de 2000-3000 de impresii, având ca efect electoral promovarea candidatului și a partidului AUR.  Conținutul postării, care prezintă un interviu cu Mohammad Murad, discutând despre rezultatele alegerilor prezidențiale și propunerile AUR pentru alegerile parlamentare, depășește limitele jurnalismului obiectiv și are ca scop influențarea votului.  Contactul Tomis Tv este h_dorian@yahoo.com și +40752181038, adresa fiind strada Daciei 28, Topraisar, Constanța 900057, RO.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
